title: How to Make Indian Lentil Soup

steps.headline: Rinse and drain the lentils.
steps.description: Place the lentils in the colander and rinse them well under a cold tap. Drain and shake off any excess water.

steps.headline: Core and dice the tomatoes.
steps.description: Remove the cores from the tomatoes, then dice them into approximately 1 centimetre / 0.5 inch cubes.

steps.headline: Heat the oil.
steps.description: Over a medium heat, warm the oil in a cooking pot.

steps.headline: Cook the chopped garlic.
steps.description: When hot, add the chopped garlic and cook for roughly one minute, stirring continuously to prevent burning.

steps.headline: Add the spices.
steps.description: Add the cumin seeds, paprika and chilli flakes and stir for a further minute.

steps.headline: Stew the tomatoes.
steps.description: Add the tomatoes, turn the heat up slightly and stew for approximately 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the lentils.
steps.description: Add the strained lentils and stir well.

steps.headline: Add water.
steps.description: Pour about a litre / 1.75pt of water into the pan, bring back to a boil and cover.

steps.headline: Cook.
steps.description: When boiling, turn down the heat to a simmer and cook for roughly thirty minutes or until the lentils are soft. Do not add any salt at this stage.

steps.headline: Prepare the parsley.
steps.description: Rinse the parsley under a cold tap and pat it dry with some kitchen paper. Spread it along a cutting board and chop coarsely, discarding any of the larger stalks. Alternatively, you can also use chopped cilantro leaves.

steps.headline: Season and add parsley.
steps.description: After thirty minutes, add some salt to season, the chopped parsley and more water if desired.

steps.headline: Serve the lentil soup.
steps.description: Ladle the lentil soup into bowls and serve with warm, crusty bread.

text: Rinse and drain the lentils. Place the lentils in the colander and rinse them well under a cold tap. Drain and shake off any excess water. Core and dice the tomatoes. Remove the cores from the tomatoes, then dice them into approximately 1 centimetre / 0.5 inch cubes. Chop the garlic. Finely chop the garlic. Heat the oil. Over a medium heat, warm the oil in a cooking pot. Cook the chopped garlic. When hot, add the chopped garlic and cook for roughly one minute, stirring continuously to prevent burning. Add the spices. Add the cumin seeds, paprika and chilli flakes and stir for a further minute. Stew the tomatoes. Add the tomatoes, turn the heat up slightly and stew for approximately 3 minutes. Add the lentils. Add the strained lentils and stir well. Add water. Pour about a litre / 1.75pt of water into the pan, bring back to a boil and cover. Cook. When boiling, turn down the heat to a simmer and cook for roughly thirty minutes or until the lentils are soft. Do not add any salt at this stage. Prepare the parsley. Rinse the parsley under a cold tap and pat it dry with some kitchen paper. Spread it along a cutting board and chop coarsely, discarding any of the larger stalks. Alternatively, you can also use chopped cilantro leaves. Season and add parsley. After thirty minutes, add some salt to season, the chopped parsley and more water if desired. Serve the lentil soup. Ladle the lentil soup into bowls and serve with warm, crusty bread.
